answers: According to the WHO, the most common symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, tiredness, and dry cough. </newline>Some patients may have aches and pains, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat or diarrhea. These symptoms are usually mild and begin gradually. </newline>Some people become infected but don't develop any symptoms and don't feel unwell. Most people (about 80%) recover from the disease without needing special treatment.</newline>People with fever, cough and difficulty breathing should seek medical attention.
expressions: What are the symptoms of Coronavirus, COVID-19?

answers: According to the World Health Organization, Coronaviruses are a large family of viruses which may cause illness in animals or humans.</newline>In humans, coronaviruses are known to cause respiratory infections ranging from the common cold to more severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).</newline> Around 1 out of every 6 people who gets COVID-19 becomes seriously ill and develops difficulty breathing. Older people, and those with underlying medical conditions like high blood pressure, heart disease or diabetes, are more likely to develop serious illness.
Please reach out to your manager or HR if you have any concerns related to COVID-19 and your work environment.
expressions: Who should I contact with work safety related COVID-19 concerns?
Who to contact with COVID concerns?
Who to contact with corona safety concerns?

answers: The WHO recommends four steps to help protect yourself: </newline>Wash your hands frequently, regardless of whether they appear dirty</newline>Maintain social distancing - keep at least three feet (1.5m) between yourself and other people. Particularly those who are coughing, sneezing and have a fever</newline>Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth </newline>If you have fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical care early
expressions: What can I do to protect myself?

answers: There are currently no confirmed cases of COVID-19 amongst our employees.</newline>If you're concerned that you may have been exposed, please speak with your manager and self-quarantine for 14 days.
expressions: Are there employees infected with COVID-19 within the office?

answers: Visit the World Health Organization at www.who.int for the latest news and resources.</newline>Also, check for real-time information on individual destinations/regions on our intranet site.
